title: VUURIX Fashion E‑commerce Website (MVP)

requirements.text: Create the VUURIX fashion storefront with core pages: Home (hero + featured products), Product Listing (browse all), Category filtering, Product Detail (images, price, description, selectable size/color if available), Cart, and Checkout (collect shipping info and place an order).

quotes: Create a e commerce  website name  VUURIX for fashion

acceptanceCriteria: Navigation exists for Home, Shop, Cart, and Checkout.
Users can browse products on a listing page and open a product detail page.
Users can add/remove items and change quantities in the cart.
Checkout form validates required fields (name, email, address) before allowing order placement.
After placing an order, the UI shows an order confirmation state with an order ID.

requirements.text: Implement product and order data models and canister APIs to support the storefront: store a catalog of fashion products (including name, description, price, category, image references, and optional variants like size/color) and allow creating and retrieving orders.

quotes: Create a e commerce  website name  VUURIX for fashion

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods to list products and fetch a product by ID.
Backend exposes methods to create an order from cart line items plus shipping info and returns an order ID.
Backend stores orders in stable storage so they persist across canister upgrades (no migration required for initial build).
Backend exposes a query method to fetch an order by ID (at least for the creator if authentication is used, otherwise available by ID for MVP).

requirements.text: Wire the frontend to the backend using React Query for loading product lists, product details, and order creation, including loading and error states.

quotes: Create a e commerce  website name  VUURIX for fashion

acceptanceCriteria: Product listing and product detail pages load data from the backend canister (not hardcoded).
Create-order action calls the backend and shows a success or error message.
All data-fetching views include a visible loading state and a visible error state.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent fashion-forward visual theme for VUURIX and enforce it consistently across the app (typography, spacing, buttons, cards, and page layout). Use English for all UI text.

quotes: Create a e commerce  website name  VUURIX for fashion

acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across all pages (same design system for buttons, forms, product cards).
Color palette avoids blue/purple by default; use a refined fashion aesthetic (e.g., monochrome/cream with high-contrast accents).
All user-facing text is English and brand name appears as “VUURIX”.

requirements.text: Add generated static brand assets and placeholders for a polished MVP: VUURIX logo, a homepage hero banner, and a small set of product placeholder images; render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image serving).

quotes: Create a e commerce  website name  VUURIX for fashion

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are committed under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI.
Home page displays the hero banner and VUURIX logo.
Products without custom images display a consistent placeholder image.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit any frontend files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose UI components instead.
Do not add external databases or non-supported backend languages/frameworks.
nonGoals: Payment processing integration (e.g., Stripe) is out of scope for this MVP unless explicitly requested later.
Admin dashboard/product management UI is out of scope; the initial catalog can be seeded in code.
Shipping rate calculation, tax calculation, and inventory management are out of scope.
Third-party authentication providers (non-Internet Identity) are out of scope.

Fashion editorial hero banner with neutral tones and abstract fabric texture, no text (vuurix-hero.dim_1600x600.png)
